member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderParamsAPI
member.summary: The DecoderParamsAPI Class contains decoder parameters that are used by multiple decoder symbologies.
member.remarks: The DecoderParamsAPI class provides access to such decoder parameters as Enabled and IsSupported, among others. This class is derived from Symbol.API and therefore can be used as with the StandardForms classes to create a UI interface for modifying/viewing the parameters.

member.name: T:Symbol.API
member.summary: The API Base class provides a common foundation for all classes that in the SMDK for .NET class libraries that will work with the StandardForms functionality.
member.remarks: The API class provides the capability of "reflecting" through objects to gain information at runtime about their properties. This capability provides an excellent way for application developers to create UI for parameters they may not necessarilly be familiar with. This class is abstract and as such may never be instantiated as is.

member.name: M:Symbol.API.#ctor
member.summary: Default API constructor.

member.name: M:Symbol.API.Save(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Abstract method that provides the capability of saving an API objects properties/parameters.
member.param: A boolean flag that when true performs a deep copy of the parameters, otherwise a shallow copy is performed.
member.returns: An object that represents the saved parameters is returned.

member.name: M:Symbol.API.Restore(System.Object)
member.summary: Abstract method provides the capability to restore previously saved API object parameters.
member.param: An object that represents the saved API parameters.

member.name: M:Symbol.API.GetProperties
member.summary: Returns all parameter/property information for the API object.
member.returns: An array of PropertyAttributes are returned. The array contains all the properties with meta-data that can be used for UI purposes.

member.name: M:Symbol.API.GetProperties(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns all parameter/property information for the API object.
member.param: A boolean flag that specifies whether or not to return optional parameters in the PropertyAttribute array.
member.returns: An array of PropertyAttributes are returned. The array contains all the properties with meta-data that can be used for UI purposes.

member.name: M:Symbol.API.GetPropertyClass(System.Type,System.Type)
member.summary: This method can be used to obtain subclass information for nested API derived objects within an API object.
member.param: The class type of the Parent Class.
The class type of the Child Class.
member.returns: Returns an PropertyClassAttribute object for a given class type.

member.name: P:Symbol.API.Text
member.summary: The text property provides a inherited class specific string.
member.value: A string that describes the API object.

member.name: P:Symbol.API.IsSupported
member.summary: A virtual property that may or may not be overridden for a derived API object.
member.value: A boolean flag. Returns true if not overridden.

member.name: P:Symbol.API.Changes
member.summary: Provides the ability to saving and restoring of API object parameters.
member.value: An InfoChanges object that performs actions on the API object.

member.name: T:Symbol.API.InfoChanges
member.summary: The InfoChanges class is used internally to help with the saving and restoring process.
member.remarks: The InfoChanges class is created by the API abstract class and is used to provide the recursive save feature. The InfoChanges object can be access using API.Changes property.

member.name: M:Symbol.API.InfoChanges.#ctor(Symbol.API)
member.summary: InfoChanges constructor is called internally to the class libraries.
member.param: An API based object to save and restore information.

member.name: M:Symbol.API.InfoChanges.Save
member.summary: Saves all properties/parameters for the given API object recursively.
member.returns: An object that represents the saved parameters.

member.name: M:Symbol.API.InfoChanges.SaveEx(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Saves all properties/parameters for the given API object.
member.param: A boolean flag. If true a deep copy of the parameters will be made, otherwise a shallow copy will be made.
member.returns: An object that represents the saved parameters.

member.name: M:Symbol.API.InfoChanges.Restore(System.Object)
member.summary: Abstract method provides the capability to restore previously saved API object parameters.
member.param: An object that represents the saved API parameters.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderParamsAPI.Save(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Saves the parameters so that they can be restored later.
member.param: When "true", the save procedure will recurse into the subclasses and save their parameters as well. (i.e. perform a deep copy).
member.returns: An object that represents the saved parameters.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderParamsAPI.Restore(System.Object)
member.summary: Restores saved parameters. The object passed as a parameter should be obtained using the method.
member.param: An object obtained that contains the saved state

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderParamsAPI.Text
member.summary: The Text property returns the name of the Decoder.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderParamsAPI.IsSupported
member.summary: Returns whether or not the Decoder is supported by the Reader.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderParamsAPI.Enabled
member.summary: Returns whether or not the Decoder is currently enabled.
member.value: Boolean flag that specifies state (true=enable,false=disable).

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderParamsAPI.MinimumLength
member.summary: Returns the minimum length of a valid barcode for the decoder.
member.value: An integer, 0-55, representing the minimum size of the barcode.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderParamsAPI.MaximumLength
member.summary: Returns the maximum length of a valid barcode for the decoder.
member.value: An integer, 0-55, representing the maximum size of the barcode.

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI
member.summary: The DecoderAPI class provides access to decoder specific parameters.
member.remarks: This class is derived from Symbol.API and therefore can be used as with the StandardForms classes to create a UI interface for modifying/viewing the parameters.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.#ctor(Symbol.Barcode.Reader)
member.summary: The DecoderAPI constructor is normally called by the Reader class during the Reader.Actions.Enable. The created object can be accessed using the Reader.Decoders property.
member.param: A Reader object to obtain decoder information from.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.Title(System.String)
member.summary: The Title method takes a given string and appends " Parameters:" to it. It is used internally to generate title string for UI purposes.
member.param: String object that contains first part of title.
member.returns: String object that contains title for UI.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.IsEnabled(Symbol.Barcode.DecoderTypes)
member.summary: Returns whether or not the given decoder is currently enabled.
member.param: A DecoderTypes enum that specifies a particular decoder.
member.returns: A boolean flag which is true if enabled, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.SetEnabled(Symbol.Barcode.DecoderTypes,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether or not a specified decoder should be enabled.
member.param: A DecoderTypes enum that specifies a particular decoder.
A boolean flag that is true if enabling a decoder, false if disabling a decoder.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.EnableAll
member.summary: Enables all available decoders so that barcodes with those symbologies will be decoded by the scanner.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.DisableAll
member.summary: Disables all available decoders so that barcodes with those symbologies will NOT be decoded by the scanner.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.EnableDefaults
member.summary: Resets decoders to their default enabled state. This is the state of the scanner drivers when the hardware is reset.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.DisableDefaults
member.summary: Disables all decoders that are enabled by default.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.Save(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Saves the parameters so that they can be restored later if necessary.
member.param: When "true", the save procedure will recurse into the subclasses and save their parameters as well. (i.e. perform a deep copy).
member.returns: An object that represents the saved parameters.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.Restore(System.Object)
member.summary: Restores saved parameters. The object passed as a parameter should be obtained using the method.
member.param: An object obtained that contains the saved state

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.dpALL
member.summary: The dpALL class provides access to parameters that are standard across all decoders. When these parameters are modified, all decoders are modified.
member.remarks: The dpALL class is normally constructed by the DecoderParamsAPI class, which is constructed by the Reader. Therefore, access to these parameters should be made through the Reader.Decoders.ALL property.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.dpALL.#ctor(Symbol.Barcode.Reader)
member.summary: The dpALL constructor should not normally be called.
member.param: The Reader object in which decoder information should come from.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.dpALL.Enabled
member.summary: The Enabled property when set to true enables all decoders, when false all decoders are disabled.
member.value: Boolean flag that specifies state (true=enable,false=disable).

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.dpALL.MinimumLength
member.summary: This property is not used. Returns 0 at all times.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.DecoderAPI.dpALL.MaximumLength
member.summary: This property is not used. Returns 0 at all times.

member.remarks: The UPCEANParamsAPI class is normally constructed by the Reader class and can be accessed through the Reader.UPCEANParams property. This class is derived from Symbol.API and can be used as with the StandardForms classes to create a UI interface for modifying/viewing the parameters.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEANParamsAPI.#ctor(Symbol.Barcode.Reader)
member.summary: The UPCEANParamsAPI constructor should not normally be called.
member.param: The Reader object from which decoder information should come from.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEANParamsAPI.Save(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Saves the parameters so that they can be restored later.
member.param: When "true", the save procedure will recurse into the subclasses and save their parameters as well. (i.e. perform a deep copy).
member.returns: An object that represents the saved parameters.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.UPCEANParamsAPI.Restore(System.Object)
member.summary: Restores saved parameters. The object passed as a parameter should be obtained using the method.
member.param: An object obtained that contains the saved state

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.ScanParamsAPI.FeedbackListPropertyInfo
member.summary: The FeedbackListPropertyInfo class provides access to a LIST of feedback types. Each feedback type will contain a separate set of parameters which can be modified to suit the needs of the scanning environment.

This class is derived from Symbol.API and can be used as with the StandardForms classes to create a UI interface for modifying/viewing the parameters.

member.name: T:Symbol.Marshaller.Accessable
member.summary: The Accessable base class is used by any derived class that encapsulates a native structure.
member.remarks: The Accessable class is derived from marshal object and therefore provides both a MarshalTo and UnmarshalFrom capability. Commonly an object derived from Accessable is accessed using the Indexers provided by this class. The index to indexers are constants that provide location information as to where in the native structure a MarshalObject resides. The derived Accessable object ususally takes on the form of an array of MarshalObjects that define the native structure in managed code.

member.name: T:Symbol.Marshaller.MarshalObject
member.summary: MarshalObject abstract base class provides a the capability of defining an object that can be passed between native and managed code or vice versa.
member.remarks: The MarshalObject is most commonly used to derive classes that will take the form of certain members inside of structures. (Examples: StringObject, FloatObject, etc.) These derived classes are used to fully describe the structure that will be marshalled.

member.name: M:Symbol.Marshaller.MarshalObject.MarshalTo(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: The MarshalTo method must be implemented by the derived class. When implemented, the method takes the managed information and marshals it into a native buffer that can be used with native function calls.
member.param: An IntPtr to a native buffer.
An integer value that indicates where in the native buffer the marshalled data should start being copied to.
member.returns: An integer offset that indicates where the next item can be placed in the native buffer. (ie the incremented offset).

member.name: M:Symbol.Marshaller.MarshalObject.UnmarshalFrom(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: The UnmarshalFrom method must be implemented by the derived class. When implemented, the method takes the native buffer and unmarshals it into managed information that can be used by the class libraries.
member.param: An IntPtr to a native buffer.
An integer offset from which to begin unmarshalling the data.
member.returns: An integer offset that indicates where the next item can be unmarshalled from the native buffer. (ie the incremented offset)

member.name: M:Symbol.Marshaller.MarshalObject.AllocMarshalPtr
member.summary: Creates a native buffer for use with the Symbol derived marshal object class. The native buffer size is based off of the property.
member.remarks: If the allocation fails the IntPtr is still returned, but the value it contains will be zero. (ie null)
member.returns: An IntPtr that points to the new native buffer.

member.name: M:Symbol.Marshaller.MarshalObject.FreeMarshalPtr(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Frees the native buffer of the marshal object.
member.param: An IntPtr that points to the native buffer.

member.name: P:Symbol.Marshaller.MarshalObject.MarshalSize
member.summary: The size in bytes of the native type that the marshal object represents.
member.value: An integer that contains the amount of bytes of the native type.

member.name: P:Symbol.Marshaller.MarshalObject.HasStructInfo
member.summary: Specifies whether or not the marshal object contains a StructInfo structure inside the native structure to be marshaled.
member.remarks: By knowing that the marshal object contains a StructInfo inside the native structure, the internal marshalling functions automatically strip out the information.
member.value: A boolean flag the specifies if the marshal object contains a StructInfo.

member.name: F:Symbol.Marshaller.Accessable.m_bModified
member.summary: Internal field, when set specifies that the object has been modified.

member.name: F:Symbol.Marshaller.Accessable.m_nOffset
member.summary: Internal field, specifies the current offset in the native buffer.

member.name: F:Symbol.Marshaller.Accessable.m_uParams
member.summary: Internal field, specifies an array of uint's. This array should not be used on new accessable objects. Replace with UintObject.

member.name: F:Symbol.Marshaller.Accessable.m_Objects
member.summary: Internal field, specfies an array of MarshalObjects, boxed.

member.name: M:Symbol.Marshaller.Accessable.#ctor
member.summary: Default Accessable constructor. No internal uints or objects instantiated during the construction process.

member.name: M:Symbol.Marshaller.Accessable.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Accessable constructor with settable number of uint (DWORD) parameters.
member.param: An integer that contains the number of DWORDs in the native buffer that the Accessable object represents.

member.name: M:Symbol.Marshaller.Accessable.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Accessable constructor with settable number of DWORD members and the offset within the native buffer where they reside.
member.param: An integer that contains the number of DWORDs in the native buffer that the Accessable object represents.
The offset within the native buffer where the DWORDs reside.

member.name: M:Symbol.Marshaller.Accessable.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Object[])
member.summary: Accessable constructor with settable number of DWORD members and an array of marshal objects that represent the native buffer in managed code.
member.param: An integer that contains the number of DWORDs in the native buffer that the Accessable object represents.
An array of Marshal objects.

member.name: M:Symbol.Marshaller.Accessable.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Object[])
member.summary: Accessable constructor with settable number of DWORD members, the offset within the native buffer where they reside, and an array of marshal objects that represent the native buffer in managed code.
member.param: An integer that contains the number of DWORDs in the native buffer that the Accessable object represents.
The offset within the native buffer where the DWORDs reside.
An array of Marshal objects.

member.name: M:Symbol.Marshaller.Accessable.#ctor(Symbol.Marshaller.Accessable)
member.summary: Accessable constructor that creates a clone of the given accessable object.
member.param: An Accessable object to create a copy of.

member.name: M:Symbol.Marshaller.Accessable.MarshalTo(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: The MarshalTo method for an Accessable object cascades through all of the marshal objects and DWORD and copies their values from managed code to the native buffer.
member.param: An IntPtr to a native buffer.
An integer value that indicates where in the native buffer the marshalled data should start being copied to.
member.returns: An integer offset that indicates where the next item can be placed in the native buffer. (ie the incremented offset).

member.name: M:Symbol.Marshaller.Accessable.UnmarshalFrom(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: The UnmarshalFrom method for an Accessable object cascasdes through all the marshal objects and DWORD entries, copying native information into the managed objects along the way.
member.param: An IntPtr to a native buffer.
An integer offset from which to begin unmarshalling the data.
member.returns: An integer offset that indicates where the next item can be unmarshalled from the native buffer. (ie the incremented offset)

member.name: P:Symbol.Marshaller.Accessable.Count
member.summary: A number that represents the amount of uints in the Accessable object.
member.remarks: This method of marshalling is no longer used. UintObjects are used to represent DWORD entries.
member.value: The number of DWORD entries in the Accessable object

member.name: P:Symbol.Marshaller.Accessable.Modified
member.summary: A flag that is set when any objects in the Accessable object are changed.

member.name: P:Symbol.Marshaller.Accessable.Objects
member.summary: Gets/sets the object array in the Accessable object.
member.value: A boxed MarshalObject array that provides a managed representation of the native structure.

member.name: P:Symbol.Marshaller.Accessable.Uints

member.remarks: Using the PropertyClassAttribute tag on a property provides a mechanism for nesting API classes within eachother. member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData
member.summary: ReaderData class encapsulates all the scanned data and meta-data for a given read.
member.remarks: The ReaderData class is most commonly used to create objects that will be passed to the method. This will start a pending read.

member.name: T:Symbol.Generic.ReaderData
member.summary: The Generic.ReaderData base class provides all common functionality that is used by all ReaderData objects.
member.remarks: The Generic.ReaderData object can be used to perform common actions on a specific ReaderData (such as Barcode.ReaderData or MagStripe.ReaderData). This allows common code to be created that acts on any ReaderData.

member.name: M:Symbol.Generic.ReaderData.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all native resources back to the system.
member.remarks: This method should be called when the ReaderData object is no longer needed by the application.

member.name: P:Symbol.Generic.ReaderData.Result
member.summary: Returns information about the status of the ReaderData.
member.value: A member of the Results enumerated type.

member.name: P:Symbol.Generic.ReaderData.Text
member.summary: Returns the data read from the device.
member.value: A string that contains the data read from the device.

member.name: P:Symbol.Generic.ReaderData.Source
member.summary: Returns information about the device that is providing the data. This is usually the device name for the device.
member.value: A string that contains the source information.

member.name: P:Symbol.Generic.ReaderData.TimeStamp
member.summary: Returns the time at which the data was acquired.
member.value: A DateTime structure that contains the time information.

member.summary: ReaderData constructor with integer based buffer size.
member.param: A member that specifies whether the memory buffer sent to the hardware will hold text or raw binary data.
An integer that specifies the size of the memory buffer in bytes for binary mode, in characters for text mode.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.#ctor(Symbol.Barcode.ReaderDataTypes,Symbol.Barcode.ReaderDataLengths)
member.summary: ReaderData constructor with enumerated type buffer size.
member.param: A member that specifies whether the memory buffer sent to the hardware will hold text or raw binary data.
An integer that specifies the size of the memory buffer in bytes for binary mode, in characters for text mode.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.Finalize
member.summary: Allows a ReaderData to attempt to free resources and perform other cleanup operations before it is reclaimed by garbage collection.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.Dispose
member.summary: Release all resources used by ReaderData object.
member.remarks:
It is highly recommended that this method be called when the ReaderData object is no longer being used by the application.
Note: Do not Dispose of the ReaderData object until any Reads associated with it have been cancelled.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.ToString
member.summary: Returns the scanned data text.
member.returns: A string of the scanned data if the memory buffer has been set to text mode.
member.exception: An InvalidDataTypeException is thrown if this property is accessed and they memory buffer has been set to binary mode.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.IsText
member.summary: Specifies whether or not the ReaderData memory buffer is set to text mode.
member.value: A boolean flag which when true indicates that the memory buffer is set to text mode, otherwise the memory buffer is set to binary mode.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.IsPending
member.summary: Specifies whether or not the ReaderData is currently in a pending read situation.
member.value: A boolean flag which when true indicate that the ReaderData has not completed a read that has been requested of it. Reads will be pending until they complete with a valid decode, fail with an error, or are cancelled.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.IsAllocated
member.summary: Specifies whether or not a memory buffer has been allocated for the ReaderData.
member.value: A boolean flag which when true indicates that a valid memory buffer has been allocated, otherwise the memory buffer has not been allocated.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.BufferSize
member.summary: Specifies the memory buffer size allocated by the ReaderData.
member.value: An integer which specifies the memory buffer size in bytes for binary mode or characters for text mode.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.Text
member.summary: Returns the scanned data text.
member.value: A string of the scanned data if the memory buffer has been set to text mode.
member.exception: An InvalidDataTypeException is thrown if this property is accessed and they memory buffer has been set to binary mode.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.RawData
member.summary: Returns a byte array with the scanned data.
member.value: A byte array with the scanned data if the ReaderDataType has been set to binary mode.
member.exception: An InvalidDataTypeException is thrown if this property is accessed and ReaderDataType has been set to text mode in the constructor of ReaderData object.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.Source
member.summary: Returns the source of the scanned data. (ie The barcode scanner device name)
member.value: A string that contains the name of the scanner which provided the source.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.TimeStamp
member.summary: The time at which the barcode was scanned.
member.value: A DateTime structure that contains the time information.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.Type
member.summary: The Decoder type of the barcode.
member.value: A member that specifies the type of barcode scanned.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.TypeHex
member.summary: The Decoder Type of the barcode in hexadecimal format.
member.value: A string of the form "0x#", where # is the decoder type in hexadecimal.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.Length
member.summary: The length of the barcode data.
member.value: An integer that specifies the length of the scanned data.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.Event
member.summary: Not currently used, returns either "Scan Complete" or "".

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.HasReader
member.summary: Specifies whether or not the ReaderData has been attached to a Reader object via a Actions.Read method call.
member.remarks: Note: This property will return true after a read has completed.
member.value: A boolean flag that when set to true indicates that the ReaderData has been attached to a Reader at some point.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.RequestId
member.summary: The ID of the read submitted to the barcode scanner hardware.
member.value: An integer that represents the ID of the requested read.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData.Result
member.summary: The result of the read request.
member.remarks: This result is a managed code version of the actual result returned by the underlying scan driver stack. It can be used to determine whether or not the read was successful or failed.
member.value: A member that indicates whether or not the read was successful.

member.summary: Registry value types

member.name: F:Symbol.Win32.RegTypes.REG_NONE
member.summary: No defined value type.

member.name: F:Symbol.Win32.RegTypes.REG_SZ
member.summary: Null-terminated string. It will be a Unicode or ANSI string, depending on whether you use the Unicode or ANSI functions.

member.name: F:Symbol.Win32.RegTypes.REG_EXPAND_SZ
member.summary: Null-terminated string that contains unexpanded references to environment variables (for example, "%PATH%"). It will be a Unicode or ANSI string, depending on whether you use the Unicode or ANSI functions.

member.name: F:Symbol.Win32.RegTypes.REG_BINARY
member.summary: Binary data in any form.

member.name: F:Symbol.Win32.RegTypes.REG_DWORD
member.summary: 32-bit number.

member.name: F:Symbol.Win32.RegTypes.REG_DWORD_LITTLE_ENDIAN
member.summary: 32-bit number in little-endian format. This is equivalent to REG_DWORD. In little-endian format, a multibyte value is stored in memory from the lowest byte (the "little end") to the highest byte. For example, the value 0x12345678 is stored as (0x78 0x56 0x34 0x12) in little-endian format.

member.name: F:Symbol.Win32.RegTypes.REG_DWORD_BIG_ENDIAN
member.summary: 32-bit number in big-endian format. In big-endian format, a multibyte value is stored in memory from the highest byte (the "big end") to the lowest byte. For example, the value 0x12345678 is stored as (0x12 0x34 0x56 0x78) in big-endian format.

member.name: F:Symbol.Win32.RegTypes.REG_LINK
member.summary: Unicode symbolic link.

member.name: F:Symbol.Win32.RegTypes.REG_MULTI_SZ
member.summary: Array of null-terminated strings that are terminated by two null characters.

member.name: F:Symbol.Win32.RegTypes.REG_RESOURCE_LIST

member.name: T:Symbol.Marshaller.GapObject
member.summary: GapObject class is used to represent gaps in a native structure. These gaps do not necessarilly need to be marshaled.
member.remarks: The gaps indicated by GapObjects provide a mechanism in which certain locations within a native structure can be skipped so that marshalling the structure using a cascade approach can still work.

member.name: M:Symbol.Marshaller.GapObject.MarshalTo(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: The MarshalTo method for a GapObject simply increments the returned offset by the gap length.
member.param: An IntPtr to a native buffer.
An integer value that indicates where in the native buffer the marshalled data should start being copied to.
member.returns: An integer offset that indicates where the next item can be placed in the native buffer. (ie the incremented offset).

member.name: M:Symbol.Marshaller.GapObject.UnmarshalFrom(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: The UnmarshalFrom method for a GapObject simply incremetns the returned offset by the gap length.
member.param: An IntPtr to a native buffer.
An integer offset from which to begin unmarshalling the data.
member.returns: An integer offset that indicates where the next item can be unmarshalled from the native buffer. (ie the incremented offset)

member.name: T:Symbol.Generic.Actions

member.remarks: The Generic.Actions object can be used to perform common actions on a specific Reader (such as Barcode.Reader or MagStripe.Reader). This allows common code to be created that acts on any Reader.

member.name: M:Symbol.Generic.Actions.Enable
member.summary: Puts the device in a state in which information can be read from the device.
member.remarks: This method is abstract and therefore is implemented by the derived class.

member.name: M:Symbol.Generic.Actions.Disable
member.summary: Puts the device in a state in which information can no longer be read from the device.
member.remarks: This method is abstract and therefore is implemented by the derived class.

member.name: M:Symbol.Generic.Actions.Flush
member.summary: Removes all pending reads from the device.
member.remarks: This method is abstract and therefore is implemented by the derived class.

member.name: M:Symbol.Generic.Actions.Read(Symbol.Generic.ReaderData)
member.summary: Initiates a read from the device. This method simply puts the class in a state in which data can be read. Commonly, some other action must take place before the read will actually complete (such as pressing a scan trigger or swiping a magnetic striped card).
member.param: A Generic.ReaderData object that will contain the data.

member.name: M:Symbol.Generic.Actions.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all native resources back to the system.
member.remarks: This method is normally called by the derived classes that instantiate the object.

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.Reader
member.summary: The Barcode.Reader class can be considered the primary class of the Barcode class library. It provides access to actions, information, and parameters.
member.remarks:
The Reader class provides all the capabilities of the scanner. It is normally constructed by having a object passed in as a parameter. Once created, actions can be performed on the reader using object returned from the property. One of the most commonly used actions is the submitting of a request. To perform a Read you will need to contruct a object and pass it as a parameter to the Read method. You will then need to attach to the event to be notified when a read completes.
Decoder and scan parameter objects can be access using the Reader.Decoders and Reader.Parameters properties, respectively.
The Dispose method of the Reader should be called when the object is no longer needed by the application.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Reader.#ctor
member.summary: Default Reader constructor creates an instance using the first available device.
member.remarks: The first available device may be a Simulated device if no scanning hardware is found. To be sure that the correct device is targeted during the instantiation of the Reader, it is suggested that you specify the Device fully using the other Reader constructors.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Reader.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Reader constructor with settable device name.
member.param: A string that contains the device name of the hardware to access. This is normally of the form "SCNx:", where the x is the number of the scanner.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Reader.#ctor(Symbol.Generic.Device)
member.summary: Reader constructor with settable Barcode.Device.
member.remarks: This is the recommended constructor to use when creating a Reader object.
member.param: A Generic.Device or object that targets a particular scanner.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Reader.Finalize
member.summary: Allows a Reader to attempt to free resources and perform other cleanup operations before it is reclaimed by garbage collection.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Reader.Dispose
member.summary: Frees up all resources used by the Reader, including any objects it has created. It is strongly recommended that this method be called when the Reader is no longer needed by the application.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Reader.GetNextReaderData
member.summary: Gets the next ReaderData object from the read completion queue.
member.remarks: The GetNextReaderData method is most commonly called by methods that have been invoked via the ReadNotify event. This method provides access to the ReaderData object of completed reads (whether the reads have been completed successfully or not should be determined from the status information provided by the ReaderData object).
member.returns: A object that has completed.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Reader.GetNextStatus
member.summary: Gets the next BarcodeStatus object from the scan status event queue.
member.remarks: The GetNextStatus method is most commonly called by methods that have been invoked via the StatusNotify event. This method provides access to the BarcodeStatus object that contains information about the scan event that has occured.
member.returns: A object with scan event information.

member.name: T:Symbol.Options
member.summary: Options class provides the capability of setting parameters that effect that way in which the SMDK for .NET class libraries work.
member.remarks: The Options class can be used to select how the class libraries should handle errors that are not necessarilly fatal, but may be useful to customer during development.

member.name: P:Symbol.Options.DebugMode
member.summary: Turn on/off debug mode exceptions.
member.value: A boolean flag that when set to true enables exceptions to be thrown in situations that are not fatal but may lead flag issues that should be addressed prior to an application's release.

member.name: T:Symbol.Stopwatch
member.summary: A helper class that provides a way in which applications can determine how long tasks are taking.
member.remarks: This class is not as accurate as a Performance Counter. It should be used for rough estimations only.

member.summary: Start stopwatch.

member.name: M:Symbol.Stopwatch.stop
member.summary: Stop stopwatch
member.returns: A TimeSpan object with time elapsed information.

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.Device
member.summary: The Symbol.Barcode.Device class provides information about to all the available scanners in the system.
member.remarks: The Symbol.Barcode.Device class provides an excellent starting point for applications that wish to gain more information about all the scanners available. The AvailableDevices property provides a static Device array with each entry mapping to available scanning hardware. Each entry contains information about the hardware and can also be used to contruct a object. This is the recommended method for instantiating Reader objects.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Device.#ctor
member.summary: Default device class constructor.
member.remarks: By default, a Barcode.Device object will be contructed with the "SCN1:" scanner targeted. Its friendly name will be "Default Reader".

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Device.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Device class constructor with settable device name.
member.remarks: A Barcode.Device object will be contructed with the given Device Name. Its friendly name will be "Explicit Reader".
member.param: The name of the device (should be in the form "SCNx:", where the x is the number of the scanner).

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Device.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Device class constructor with settable device name and friendly name.
member.remarks: A Barcode.Device object will be contructed with the given Device Name and Friendly Name.
member.param: The name of the device (should be in the form "SCNx:", where the x is the number of the scanner).
A friendly name for the device. Can be any string.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Device.Title
member.summary: Static title of the barcode device class.
member.value: A String that returns "Barcode".

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Device.AvailableDevices
member.summary: The AvailableDevices property can be used to obtain a list of all available hardware for use with the barcode classes.
member.remarks: The AvailableDevices property provides a static Device array with each entry mapping to available scanning hardware. Each entry contains information about the hardware and can also be used to contruct a object. This is the recommended method for instantiating Reader objects.
member.value: A array that represents all available scanning hardware.

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.CodeIdTypes
member.summary: Describes the type of Code ID to be reported.
member.remarks:
The Symbol Technologies, Inc. CodeIDs are documented in the following table:
Code Type Symbol Tech. Identifier
UPC-A, UPC-E, UPC-E1, UPC-E0, EAN-13, EAN-8 A
Code 39, Code 39 Full ASCII, Code 32 B
Codabar C
Code 128, ISBT 128 D
Code 93 E
Interleaved 2 of 5 F
Discrete 2 of 5, D 2 of 5 IATA G
MSI Plessey J
UCC/EAN 128 K
Bookland EAN L
Trioptic Code 39 M
UPC/EAN Coupon Code N
PDF417 X
Data Matrix P00
Maxicode P02
US Postnet P03
US Planet P04
Japan Postal P05
UK Postal P06
Australian Postal P09

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.CodeIdTypes.None

member.summary: Use Symbol Technologies Code ID.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.CodeIdTypes.AIM
member.summary: Use AIM Code ID.

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.ScanTypes
member.summary: The type of scan requests.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.ScanTypes.Foreground
member.summary: Foreground reads take priorty over background reads. When submitting a foreground read the application should be the topmost window.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.ScanTypes.Background
member.summary: Background reads can be superceded by foreground reads. Background reads are usually submitted by background applications such as a scan wedge program.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.ScanTypes.Monitor
member.summary: Monitor reads provide a way in which programs can listen in on all scans that take place.

member.name: F:Symbol.Barcode.IMAGER_SPECIFIC.PicklistMode
member.summary: This parameter allows the imager to decode only the barcode that is directly under the cross-hair/reticule (+) part of the AIM pattern. This feature is most useful in applications where multiple barcodes may appear in the field of view during a decode session and only one of them is targeted for decode. When enabled, bPicklistMode will override dwAimMode if no aiming is chosen and use the AIM_MODE_RETICLE mode. When enabled, bPicklistMode may adversely affect overall decoding performance. ENABLE Enables picklist mode, so only the barcode under the cross-hair can be decoded. DISABLE Disables picklist mode, so any barcode within the field of view can be decoded.

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.BarcodeStatus
member.summary: The BarcodeStatus class provides access to notification information.
member.remarks: The BarcodeStatus class is normally obtained from the method. The GetNextStatus() method is usually called when a StatusNotify event has been fired and your event processing method (EventHandler) has been invoked. During your event processing the BarcodeStatus object is obtained so that information about the status change can be retrieved.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.BarcodeStatus.#ctor(Symbol.Barcode.EventTypes,Symbol.Barcode.States,System.String)
member.summary: The BarcodeStatus constructor is not normally called by the developer.
member.param: An EventTypes enumerated type that defines the type of event that has occurred.
A States enumerated type that defines the new state of the Reader.
The state of the Reader in string form.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.BarcodeStatus.Type
member.summary: Retrieves the Barcode Reader event type.
member.value: An EventTypes member that defines the type of event that has occured.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.BarcodeStatus.State
member.summary: Retrieves the Barcode.Reader event state.
member.value: A State member that defines the new state of the Reader.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.BarcodeStatus.Text
member.summary: Retrieves the Barcode.Reader state in string form.
member.value: The string representation of the Barcode.Reader state.

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.Info
member.summary: The Barcode.Info Class contains information about the scanner.
member.remarks: The Info class is normally constructed by the Reader class and can be accessed using the Reader.Info property.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Info.#ctor(Symbol.Barcode.Reader)
member.summary: The Info class constructor is not normally called.
member.param: A Reader object from which the information will be obtained.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Info.IsEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether or not the Reader is enabled.
member.value: A boolean flag which when true indicates that the Reader is enabled, otherwise it is disabled.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Info.IsSimulating
member.summary: Read only property returns whether or not the reader is in simulation mode.
member.remarks: Simulation mode is used primarily by the class libraries to allow support for programming using the "stock" emulators provided by Microsoft. While in simulation mode scans are faked so that programs can be tested and developed.
member.value: A boolean flag which when true indicates that the Reader is in simulation mode, otherwise actual hardware has been targeted.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Info.PendingReads
member.summary: Returns the number of pending reads.
member.remarks: A pending read is a read that has been submitted but has not yet completed. To submit a pending read call the method. A read completes by either a successful decode, a failed decode, or due to a cancellation of the read.
member.value: An integer which returns the number of current pending reads.

member.name: P:Symbol.Barcode.Info.SoftTrigger
member.summary: The state of the soft-trigger.
member.remarks: A soft-trigger is a trigger that has been initiated via software. Unlike a hard trigger initiated by a physical button press.
member.value: A boolean flag which when true sets the state of the soft-trigger to on. If a read is pending then the laser will turn on. When the flag is set to false the laser will turn off.

member.name: T:Symbol.Barcode.Actions
member.summary: Performs actions on the Reader.
member.remarks: The Symbol.Barcode.Actions is used to perform actions on the scanner hardware. Such actions include starting and canceling pending reads, as well as, enabling and disabling the hardware. The class is normally contructed by the class during its instantiation process.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Actions.Finalize
member.summary: Allows an Action object to attempt to free resources and perform other cleanup operations before it is reclaimed by garbage collection.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Actions.Dispose
member.summary: Release any resources used by the Actions class.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Actions.Enable
member.summary: Enables the scanner hardware. This method does not make the scanner scan or turn on the laser.
member.remarks: The Enable() method may take a while to process due to that fact that it instantiates the ScanParamsAPI, DecoderAPI, and UPCANParamsAPI, and Version objects. During this time the WaitCursor will be displayed on the screen. The Enable() method allows this initialization to be done when it least impacts the user experience (e.g. entry to a form). To perform the scan of a barcode additional methods must be called.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Actions.Disable
member.summary: Disables the scanner hardware. Reverses the process. The scanner must be re-enabled before its use if it has been disabled.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Actions.Read(Symbol.Generic.ReaderData)
member.summary: Starts a pending read. The method will not turn on the laser. It will, however, put the scanner in a state in which the laser can be turned on either by pressing a hardware trigger or by performing a software trigger.
member.param: The ReaderData object that will contain the scanned data once the read completes.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Actions.Flush
member.summary: Removes all pending reads from the Reader. The Flush method is the same as called the method for all pending reads.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Actions.CancelRead(Symbol.Barcode.ReaderData)
member.summary: Removes a single pending read from the Reader. This method will only work if the given ReaderData object is still in a pending read situation (i.e. the read has been submitted but no notification of a read completion or failure has occurred).
member.param: A ReaderData object that has a pending read.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Actions.ToggleSoftTrigger
member.summary: Toggles the soft trigger of the scanner.

member.name: M:Symbol.Barcode.Actions.NewReaderData
member.summary: Creates a generic ReaderData object for use with a Symbol.Barcode.Reader object.
member.remarks: The Symbol.Generic base classes provide a level of abstraction for data providers such as Barcode Readers and Magnetic Stripe Readers. This abstraction provides application developers with the capability to write generic code that can be used across different data providers and hardware. Since only common functionality is provided by the Generic classes, some specific features may be lost.
member.returns: A generic ReaderData object.

member.name: T:Barcode.CodeIdTypes
member.summary: Describes the type of Code ID to be reported.
member.remarks:
The Symbol Technologies, Inc. CodeIDs are documented in the following table:
Code Type Symbol Tech. Identifier
UPC-A, UPC-E, UPC-E1, UPC-E0, EAN-13, EAN-8 A
Code 39, Code 39 Full ASCII, Code 32 B
Codabar C
Code 128, ISBT 128 D
Code 93 E
Interleaved 2 of 5 F
Discrete 2 of 5, D 2 of 5 IATA G
MSI Plessey J
UCC/EAN 128 K
Bookland EAN L
Trioptic Code 39 M
UPC/EAN Coupon Code N
PDF417 X
Data Matrix P00
Maxicode P02
US Postnet P03
US Planet P04
Japan Postal P05
UK Postal P06
Australian Postal P09

member.name: F:Barcode.ScanTypes.Foreground
member.summary: Foreground reads take priorty over background reads. When submitting a foreground read the application should be the topmost window.

member.name: F:Barcode.ScanTypes.Background
member.summary: Background reads can be superceded by foreground reads. Background reads are usually submitted by background applications such as a scan wedge program.

member.name: F:Barcode.ScanTypes.Monitor
member.summary: Monitor reads provide a way in which programs can listen in on all scans that take place.
